name: Bharathi Park
address: Bharathi Park, White Town, Central heritage zone, Puducherry, 605001

description.nameOrigin: Originally named Place du Gouvernement during French colonial period. Renamed Bharathi Park after Indian independence in honour of Subramania Bharathi, the famous Tamil poet, freedom fighter, and journalist who lived in Puducherry.
description.historicalImportance: Bharathi Park was originally developed during the French colonial period. The park is centrally located in White Town, surrounded by historic buildings like Raj Nivas (Governor's House), Puducherry Museum, and French Government buildings.
description.naturalFeatures: Heritage park with French-style layout, greenery, and the famous Aayi Mandapam monument.
description.maintenance: Maintained by the Puducherry Municipal Administration & Public Works Department.
description.specialFeatures: The park is specifically known for heritage walks, calm seating space in the city center, photography and architectural appreciation. Inside the park stands the famous Aayi Mandapam, a Greco-Roman style monument built in remembrance of Aayi, a woman who sacrificed her house to build a water reservoir for the city.

crowdLevel: Low to Medium (Weekdays), Medium to High (Weekends & Evenings), High (Festival days / tourist season)
seasonalNotes: Evening lighting enhances monument beauty. Ideal stop during White Town heritage walk.

name: Rajiv Gandhi Children's Park
address: Rajiv Gandhi Children's Park, Goubert Avenue (Beach Road), White Town, Puducherry, 605001

description.nameOrigin: The park is named after Rajiv Gandhi, former Prime Minister of India.
description.historicalImportance: Rajiv Gandhi Children's Park was developed as a dedicated recreational park for children. It is located along Goubert Avenue (Beach Road), making it a popular stop for families visiting the promenade.
description.naturalFeatures: Children's play area with slides, swings, and play equipment. Shaded seating for parents.
description.maintenance: Maintained by the Puducherry Municipal Administration.
description.specialFeatures: The park was created to provide safe play space for children and relaxation area for parents. It is specifically known as a kids-only attraction rather than a heritage or walking park.

dressCode: Decent / Comfortable clothing preferred (Kids-friendly casual wear recommended)
crowdLevel: Medium (Weekdays), High (Weekends & Evenings), Very High (School holidays)

restrictions: Adults without children may be restricted

seasonalNotes: Very crowded during weekends. Ideal after Promenade Beach walk.

name: Indira Gandhi Park
address: Indira Gandhi Park, Indira Gandhi Square, Central Puducherry, 605001

description.nameOrigin: The park is named in honour of Indira Gandhi, former Prime Minister of India.
description.historicalImportance: Indira Gandhi Park is a public urban park developed for everyday recreation. It is located at Indira Gandhi Square, one of the busy junctions in central Puducherry.
description.naturalFeatures: Small landscaped green area with seating benches and Indira Gandhi statue.
description.maintenance: Maintained by the Puducherry Municipal Administration.
description.specialFeatures: The park was created to provide green relief in a traffic-heavy area and seating and relaxation space for locals. It serves mainly as a neighbourhood park and a short-rest stop for commuters. It is not a children-only or heritage park, but a general public park.

crowdLevel: Low to Medium (Weekdays), Medium (Weekends & Evenings), Medium (Peak hours - traffic time)
seasonalNotes: More peaceful during mornings. Acts as a green pause in busy traffic zone.

name: Jawahar Bal Bhavan Children's Park
location: Jawahar Bal Bhavan Complex, Central Puducherry - 605001
address: Jawahar Bal Bhavan Children's Park, Jawahar Bal Bhavan Complex, Central Puducherry, 605001

description.nameOrigin: Named after Jawaharlal Nehru, India's first Prime Minister, who strongly supported children's education and creativity.
description.historicalImportance: Jawahar Bal Bhavan was established as a children-focused cultural and recreational centre. The park functions as part of the Bal Bhavan complex, not just a standalone park.
description.naturalFeatures: Children's play area with open ground for activities and cultural program space.
description.maintenance: Maintained by the Department of Art & Culture, Government of Puducherry.
description.specialFeatures: Developed to promote children's creativity, physical activity, and cultural learning. The park is specific for children's recreation, school programs, and cultural and educational activities. Unlike beachside children parks, this park has a learning + play combination.

dressCode: Decent / Comfortable clothing preferred (Children-friendly attire recommended)
crowdLevel: Low to Medium (Weekdays), Medium to High (Weekends & Evenings), High (School holidays)

restrictions: Adults without children may have limited access

seasonalNotes: Cultural events attract crowds. Good educational environment for kids.

name: Subramania Bharathi Park
address: Subramania Bharathi Park, Muthialpet, Dense residential area, Puducherry, 605003

description.nameOrigin: The park is named after Subramania Bharathi, the renowned Tamil poet, freedom fighter, and social reformer who lived and worked in Puducherry.
description.historicalImportance: Subramania Bharathi Park is a local neighbourhood public park serving the Muthialpet area. The park was developed to provide green space within a crowded residential locality and a safe walking and resting area for residents.
description.naturalFeatures: Green shaded walking paths, seating benches, calm environment away from traffic.
description.maintenance: Maintained by the Puducherry Municipal Administration.
description.specialFeatures: The park functions primarily as a community park and daily-use recreation space for locals. It is specific for morning walks, evening relaxation, and senior citizens' meetups. Unlike Bharathi Park (White Town), this park is not a heritage site, but a functional local park.

name: Anna Thidal / Anna Park
location: Near New Bus Stand area (Anna Salai side), Central Puducherry - 605001
address: Anna Thidal, Anna Salai, Near New Bus Stand, Central Puducherry, 605001

description.nameOrigin: Named after C. N. Annadurai (Anna), former Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu and a prominent Dravidian leader.
description.historicalImportance: Anna Thidal is a public memorial park / open ground developed for gatherings and daily recreation. The park was created to serve as a community open space, memorial spot, and small recreation area in a busy transport zone.
description.naturalFeatures: Open ground space with seating areas and memorial association.
description.maintenance: Maintained by the Puducherry Municipal Administration.
description.specialFeatures: The park is mainly used for public gatherings (occasionally), short rest breaks for commuters, and evening walks for nearby residents. It is functional rather than ornamental—not a children's park or heritage park.

crowdLevel: Low (Weekdays), Medium (Weekends & Evenings), Medium to High (Event days)
seasonalNotes: Useful rest stop near bus stand. Quiet during mornings, active evenings.

name: Auroville Youth Centre Playground & Green Space
nameTamil: ஆரோவில் இளைஞர் மையம் விளையாட்டு மைதானம் & பசுமை இடம்
location: Auroville (near Town Hall / Youth Centre zone), Puducherry - 605101
address: Auroville Youth Centre Playground, Auroville, near Town Hall, Puducherry, 605101

description.nameOrigin: Developed as part of Auroville Youth Centre to encourage sports, fitness, and youth engagement.
description.historicalImportance: The Auroville Youth Centre Playground is a community recreation park within Auroville township. Developed to encourage sports, fitness, and youth engagement in line with Auroville's ideals of holistic development.
description.naturalFeatures: Open playground with green shaded areas and calm, pollution-free environment.
description.maintenance: Maintained by Auroville community bodies / maintenance services.
description.specialFeatures: The area functions as a playground, open green space, and community gathering zone. The park is not a botanical garden or restricted spiritual area; it is open for public use (respecting Auroville rules). It is specific for youth sports activities, fitness routines, and community events. Tourists can visit, but locals and Auroville residents are the primary users.

dressCode: Decent / Comfortable clothing preferred (Sportswear recommended for activities)
crowdLevel: Low to Medium (Weekdays), Medium (Weekends & Evenings), Medium to High (During sports events)
seasonalNotes: Pleasant climate due to greenery. Quiet and disciplined atmosphere.
